intro: Ferdinandusa paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense fern, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by red, fleshy fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and swampy areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
